description: End users may notice that when interacting with the Windows printing service, especially on systems with builds such as Windows 10 Version 22H2 (10.0.19045.4046) and Windows Server 2016 (10.0.14393.6709), the service exhibits unpredictable behavior. This could include instances where documents fail to print or are redirected unexpectedly, suggesting the presence of a spoofing issue. Additionally, users might experience increased error messages during print jobs, leading to disrupted workflows. Administrators will find that resolving these issues requires attention to the updates detailed in KB-5034763 to ensure that the printing service is operating correctly, minimizing any unauthorized manipulation. Overall, these observable symptoms may hinder productivity and create unnecessary delays within organizational processes.
